trans-unit.source: Registering and Updating a BizTalk Service Deployment on the BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Registering and Updating a BizTalk Service Deployment on the BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: When you ‘register’ a BizTalk Service, you are associating your BizTalk Service (and its Issuer Name and Issuer Key) with your project deployments in the <token>af_integration</token> portal.
trans-unit.target: When you ‘register’ a BizTalk Service, you are associating your BizTalk Service (and its Issuer Name and Issuer Key) with your project deployments in the <token>af_integration</token> portal.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists your registration options and the steps to register your BizTalk Service in the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists your registration options and the steps to register your BizTalk Service in the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Before you Begin
trans-unit.target: Before you Begin

trans-unit.source: When registration occurs, the BizTalk Service deployment is automatically associated with the Organization account or Microsoft Account you are logged in as.
trans-unit.target: When registration occurs, the BizTalk Service deployment is automatically associated with the Organization account or Microsoft Account you are logged in as.

trans-unit.source: When this association is done, only an organization account or Microsoft account has access to the BizTalk Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: When this association is done, only an organization account or Microsoft account has access to the BizTalk Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: It cannot be changed.
trans-unit.target: It cannot be changed.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Example</legacyBold>: You are logged in as user@contoso.com (an organizational account) when the BizTalk Services deployment is registered.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Example</legacyBold>: You are logged in as user@contoso.com (an organizational account) when the BizTalk Services deployment is registered.

trans-unit.source: If user@live.com logs in, this user <legacyUnderline>cannot</legacyUnderline> access the BizTalk Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: If user@live.com logs in, this user <legacyUnderline>cannot</legacyUnderline> access the BizTalk Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: Only users within the same organization (@contoso.com) can view and manage the BizTalk Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: Only users within the same organization (@contoso.com) can view and manage the BizTalk Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Example</legacyBold>: The same for Microsoft accounts (@live.com, @hotmail.com, and @outlook.com).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Example</legacyBold>: The same for Microsoft accounts (@live.com, @hotmail.com, and @outlook.com).

trans-unit.source: For example, you are logged in as user@live.com (a Microsoft account) when the BizTalk Services deployment is registered.
trans-unit.target: For example, you are logged in as user@live.com (a Microsoft account) when the BizTalk Services deployment is registered.

trans-unit.source: If user@outlook.com (a Microsoft account) logs in, this user <legacyUnderline>can</legacyUnderline> access and manage the BizTalk Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: If user@outlook.com (a Microsoft account) logs in, this user <legacyUnderline>can</legacyUnderline> access and manage the BizTalk Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: If user@contoso.com (an organizational account) logs in, this user <legacyUnderline>cannot</legacyUnderline> access the BizTalk Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: If user@contoso.com (an organizational account) logs in, this user <legacyUnderline>cannot</legacyUnderline> access the BizTalk Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: Only users with a Microsoft account can view and manage the BizTalk Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: Only users with a Microsoft account can view and manage the BizTalk Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: Users (user@live.com or user@contoso.com) can be added as guests in an Azure Active Directory (user@fabrikam.com).
trans-unit.target: Users (user@live.com or user@contoso.com) can be added as guests in an Azure Active Directory (user@fabrikam.com).

trans-unit.source: These Guests cannot access the BizTalk Services deployment.
trans-unit.target: These Guests cannot access the BizTalk Services deployment.

trans-unit.source: The schemas that conform to the X12 4010 and 5010 standards are available at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The schemas that conform to the X12 4010 and 5010 standards are available at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: If messages will be signed and encrypted, a private certificate (.pfx) and a public certificate (.cer) are needed.
trans-unit.target: If messages will be signed and encrypted, a private certificate (.pfx) and a public certificate (.cer) are needed.

trans-unit.source: For information on importing certificates, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on importing certificates, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.

trans-unit.source: If you are using bridges and transforms as part of your solution, you must also install the <token>af_integration</token> SDK.
trans-unit.target: If you are using bridges and transforms as part of your solution, you must also install the <token>af_integration</token> SDK.

trans-unit.source: You can use the SDK to create these artifacts that might be required while configuring agreements.
trans-unit.target: You can use the SDK to create these artifacts that might be required while configuring agreements.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="10873203-56b3-445c-8340-ef073f5365f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Installing the Azure AppFabric September 2011 CTP</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="10873203-56b3-445c-8340-ef073f5365f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Installing the Azure AppFabric September 2011 CTP</link>.

trans-unit.source: Register with the Portal
trans-unit.target: Register with the Portal

trans-unit.source: If you registered a <token>af_integration</token> subscription with the <token>tpm_portal</token> for the Preview release of <token>af_integration</token>, you must re-register the subscription for the current release.
trans-unit.target: If you registered a <token>af_integration</token> subscription with the <token>tpm_portal</token> for the Preview release of <token>af_integration</token>, you must re-register the subscription for the current release.

trans-unit.source: Note that the artifacts, partners, agreements, etc. that you created or deployed in the Preview registration will be preserved in the new registration as well.
trans-unit.target: Note that the artifacts, partners, agreements, etc. that you created or deployed in the Preview registration will be preserved in the new registration as well.

trans-unit.source: When the BizTalk Service is ‘registered’, you are proving ownership to the BizTalk Service by providing the <token>ac2</token> Issuer Name and Issuer Key.
trans-unit.target: When the BizTalk Service is ‘registered’, you are proving ownership to the BizTalk Service by providing the <token>ac2</token> Issuer Name and Issuer Key.

trans-unit.source: There are two options to register your BizTalk Service:
trans-unit.target: There are two options to register your BizTalk Service:

trans-unit.source: OPTION 1: Automatically register by clicking “Manage”
trans-unit.target: OPTION 1: Automatically register by clicking “Manage”

trans-unit.source: When you create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token> and you then select <embeddedLabel>Manage</embeddedLabel> for the first time, your BizTalk Service (and its Issuer Name and Issuer Key) is automatically registered in the <token>af_integration</token> portal.
trans-unit.target: When you create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token> and you then select <embeddedLabel>Manage</embeddedLabel> for the first time, your BizTalk Service (and its Issuer Name and Issuer Key) is automatically registered in the <token>af_integration</token> portal.

trans-unit.source: If access to your deployments uses Organizational accounts, then log into the <token>azportal</token> as your organizational account, create the BizTalk Service, and then click <legacyBold>Manage</legacyBold> to automatically register.
trans-unit.target: If access to your deployments uses Organizational accounts, then log into the <token>azportal</token> as your organizational account, create the BizTalk Service, and then click <legacyBold>Manage</legacyBold> to automatically register.

trans-unit.source: If access to your deployments uses Microsoft accounts, then log into the <token>azportal</token> as your Microsoft account, create the BizTalk Service, and then click <legacyBold>Manage</legacyBold> to automatically register.
trans-unit.target: If access to your deployments uses Microsoft accounts, then log into the <token>azportal</token> as your Microsoft account, create the BizTalk Service, and then click <legacyBold>Manage</legacyBold> to automatically register.

trans-unit.source: OPTION 2: Automatically register using the BizTalk Service portal
trans-unit.target: OPTION 2: Automatically register using the BizTalk Service portal

trans-unit.source: You create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token> and you do <legacyUnderline>not</legacyUnderline> select <legacyBold>Manage</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: You create a BizTalk Service in the <token>azportal</token> and you do <legacyUnderline>not</legacyUnderline> select <legacyBold>Manage</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: To automatically register the BizTalk Service, log in to the <token>af_integration</token> portal ( HYPERLINK "https://YourBizTalkServiceName.portal.biztalk.windows.net/" https://YourBizTalkServiceName.portal.biztalk.windows.net/) using the same account (Microsoft or Organizational) that created the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: To automatically register the BizTalk Service, log in to the <token>af_integration</token> portal ( HYPERLINK "https://YourBizTalkServiceName.portal.biztalk.windows.net/" https://YourBizTalkServiceName.portal.biztalk.windows.net/) using the same account (Microsoft or Organizational) that created the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Logging in with this same account automatically registers the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Logging in with this same account automatically registers the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: If access to your deployments uses Organizational accounts, then log into the <token>af_integration</token> portal as the organizational account to automatically register.
trans-unit.target: If access to your deployments uses Organizational accounts, then log into the <token>af_integration</token> portal as the organizational account to automatically register.

trans-unit.source: If access to your deployments uses Microsoft accounts, then log into the <token>af_integration</token> portal as the Microsoft account to automatically register.
trans-unit.target: If access to your deployments uses Microsoft accounts, then log into the <token>af_integration</token> portal as the Microsoft account to automatically register.

trans-unit.source: Additional
trans-unit.target: Additional

trans-unit.source: When you log into the <token>azportal</token> to provision a <token>af_integration</token>, you are logged in with a specific Microsoft or Organizational account.
trans-unit.target: When you log into the <token>azportal</token> to provision a <token>af_integration</token>, you are logged in with a specific Microsoft or Organizational account.

trans-unit.source: You can add additional accounts to manage the <token>af_integration</token> subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can add additional accounts to manage the <token>af_integration</token> subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can also associate a single Microsoft or Organizational account with multiple <token>af_integration</token> subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: You can also associate a single Microsoft or Organizational account with multiple <token>af_integration</token> subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: To achieve this many-to-many association, see <link xlink:href="ce34c646-44a6-48be-a9de-813a39e334d5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Associating Multiple Login IDs with a BizTalk Services Deployment</link>.
trans-unit.target: To achieve this many-to-many association, see <link xlink:href="ce34c646-44a6-48be-a9de-813a39e334d5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Associating Multiple Login IDs with a BizTalk Services Deployment</link>.

trans-unit.source: Create a BizTalk Service using Azure management portal
trans-unit.target: Create a BizTalk Service using Azure management portal

trans-unit.target: Next
